Nathan Algren.Action: Shows signs of physical and emotional weariness, barely listens and takes a swig from a flask backstage, indicating possible struggle with confidence or mental health.
Recognized as a true American hero and patriot, publicly praised for gallantry and battlefield success, indicating previous competence and skill.
Looks fondly at his brother, engages in lighthearted banter, and punches his shoulder.

Refuses to consider surrender despite an order to do so, insisting on fighting on.

Hesitates and laughs instead of taking his own life despite deep despair.

Stands close to Taka and communicates with sincerity before battle, indicating respectful and sincere connection.
Receives the samurai sword from Katsumoto, bows respectfully, and collaborates with Katsumoto in planning the next day's battle strategy.
Puts on his recovered breast-plate armor thoughtfully and confidently prepares to enter battle, demonstrating readiness and acceptance of his role.
Calmly instructs Graham to stay with the horses, showing concern for his safety and matching responsibility to capability.
Gives his journal to Graham for use in his book, an act of trust and kindness amid battle.
Shares a grim smile when asked about the fate of the 300 warriors at Thermopylae, showing a somber respect for sacrifice.
Calmly coordinates and watches the samurai's tactical movements alongside Katsumoto, demonstrating trust and solidarity.
Shares a reflective moment with Katsumoto about the nature of soldiers vs warriors, showing thoughtfulness and respect.
Prepares to fight alongside Katsumoto and the samurai, demonstrating loyalty and solidarity.
Assesses the enemy's movements and communicates the timing of their next attack confidently to Katsumoto.
Prepares to fight alongside Katsumoto by drawing his sword before the second wave charge.
Leads the charge alongside Katsumoto, fighting back to back with him, demonstrating cooperation and trust.
Kills an approaching soldier to protect Katsumoto, showing loyalty and protective behavior.
Continues to fight despite being wounded, maintaining courage and commitment to comrades.
Leads a charge over the second barricade alongside Katsumoto, fights back to back seamlessly in brutal hand-to-hand combat, skillfully slashing and defending.
Dodges a bayonet attack but is cut in the side; immediately recovers to kick the attacker away and attempts to counterattack with his sword.
Depends on an ally (Ujio) to deliver the final blow against a charging soldier after being wounded and struggling to finish the fight himself.
Acknowledges the hopelessness of the battle but chooses to stay and fight alongside Katsumoto.
Shares a sincere, quiet moment of understanding and mutual respect with Katsumoto regarding life, death, and survival.
Fights desperately alongside Katsumoto despite being wounded and exhausted, displaying resilience and skill in battle.
Acknowledges the likely defeat and the need to hold back next wave but chooses to stay and face overwhelming odds with a calm and resolved demeanor.
Reflects on his past and survival with a sense of acceptance and purpose, indicating mental clarity and confidence amid chaos.
Affixes Medal of Honor to his tunic, silently agrees with Katsumoto's resolve
Charges alongside Katsumoto with courage and determination despite being wounded
Drags the dying Katsumoto away from battlefield under heavy fire, staying by his side despite danger.
Helps the dying Katsumoto to stand despite his own injuries, physically supporting him during a critical and emotional moment.
Refuses to perform kaishaku (a mercy beheading), showing emotional conflict and hesitation in decisively ending Katsumoto's suffering.
Demonstrates emotional strength and presence by holding Katsumoto firmly during his death, providing comfort.
Observes the scene Katsumoto was looking at and acknowledges the beauty of the moment (cherry blossoms), showing mindfulness and respect.
Enters the Imperial Palace to present the treaty documents, indicating his role in official and diplomatic proceedings.
Kneels and respectfully sets Katsumoto's sword at the Emperor's feet, remains kneeling with bowed head, and solemnly delivers Katsumoto's final message.
Kneels and respectfully presents Katsumoto's sword to the Emperor, following samurai tradition and honoring the fallen leader's last wish.
Speaks clearly and confidently to the Emperor, conveying Katsumoto's intentions and the symbolic meaning of the sword.
Does not intervene or respond as the Emperor confronts Omura and Ambassador Swanbeck, remaining silent and passive in this critical political moment.
Sits peacefully alone under cherry blossoms, smiles with quiet joy at Taka.
